required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: GDM Screening During COVID Pandemic. IADPSG vs WHO '99 Criteria
clinical_study.official_title: Screening of GDM During COVID Pandemic in an Italian Setting. Comparison Between IADPSG and WHO '99 Criteria

brief_summary.textblock:
All pregnant women who performed an OGTT following Italian Guidelines and then delivered at our University Hospital from march 2020 to march 2021 were prospectively enrolled in this study. Primary outcome of the study was the number of women to whom was diagnosed GDM with only the fasting glucose value (≥ 92 mg/dl), following Italian Diabetes Societies recommendations for COVID 19 pandemic period. In the same time, we prospectively collected the data of women who became diabetic following the criteria of WHO 1999 (fast glucose value ≥ 120 mg/dl, 2 hours later ≥ 140 mg/dl) still in use in some large countries like India. From the clinical charts, we reported the distribution of risk factors for GDM (maternal age ≥ 35 years, family history for diabetes type 2, ethnia, BMI ≥ 25, previous GDM) and clinical outcomes such as hypertensive disorders, preterm birth, macrosomia, intrauterine growth restriction and Caesarean section in emergency.
These data will be compared between the 2 groups consisting in those diagnosed with only IADPSG criteria versus those diagnosed with only WHO '99 criteria.

primary_outcome.measure: prevalence of women with a diagnosis of GDM following guidelines during COVID pamdemic
primary_outcome.description: evaluation of fast glucose level in the period recommended for GDM screening following Italian guidelines

secondary_outcome.measure: GDM diagnosis with IADPSG criteria versus WHO '99 criteria
secondary_outcome.description: difference in risk factors and clinical outcomes between groups

clinical_study.condition: Comparison Between IADPSG vs WHO '99 Criteria

intervention.description: difference in risk factors and clinical outcomes between groups

study_pop.textblock: All pregnant women who in a 12-month period perform GDM screening and then deliver at our University Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Pregnant women who perform GDM screening -
Exclusion Criteria: Twin pregnancies
-

results_reference.citation: van-de-l'Isle Y, Steer PJ, Watt Coote I, Cauldwell M. Impact of changes to national UK Guidance on testing for gestational diabetes screening during a pandemic: a single-centre observational study. BJOG. 2021 Apr;128(5):917-920. doi: 10.1111/1471-0528.16482. Epub 2020 Oct 7.

responsible_party.investigator_title: full professor of obstetrics and gynecology
